body_content.explanation: in the UK, a private school (= a school paid for by parents, not the government) for children, especially boys, between the ages of seven and 13, who will then usually go to public school (= a type of private secondary school):
examples: In the private sector they keep children at prep schools until the age of 13 before they move to secondary.
I have three children in prep school in Hampstead.

body_content.explanation: in the US, a private school for children over the age of eleven that prepares them to go to college:
examples: The point of the prep school was to get Jeff into a good college with a hockey team.
My brother Bobby was in prep school in Connecticut.
